Lástima que la historia sea tan cortita, pero merece la pena.
It's good but portal 2 its better.

作为V社的看家游戏，传送门不但获得了游戏史上分数第二高的成就（第一是Valve 自家的《半条命2》）还将当年的游戏大奖拿到手软的同时做到了最佳电脑游戏、最佳XBOX360游戏和最佳PS3游戏，全平台制霸。这是第一个让玩家意识到FPS游戏不只是射击的游戏。完美的诠释了什么叫“第九艺术”。Portal 最大的特点是做到了极具想象力和游戏艺术性完美结合。如果你静下心去探索这个游戏，你会发现这个游戏可能会成为你玩过的最优秀的游戏。

This game is more than meets the eye. What seems like a basic puzzle game with a futuristic twist is actually a story with a lot of dark twists and unexpected solutions. Don’t believe me? Get it yourself.

The beginning of masterpiece Portal 2. GLaDOS may be stiff at first on Portal but she still is the sacarsm person that loves to test play us. Good level designs, fun puzzles, short but memorable experiences along the dreadful atmosphere and mysterious lores behind. The advanced chambers also make you think more with techniques you already learned. 
.
But just one thing... the-Challenges-are-totally-full-of-fucking-b*llsh!t. No sensations of improving yourself, no learning curves or hints, and the difficulty just spikes out of space. Either you have to be super pros or follow exactly inch by inch of one solution then you can dream of getting at least a bronze medal. You are not allowed to make a milli mistake!. Even if you try hard the game just f*cks you with limited physics, interaction & camera view. You cannot E grabing things fast (especially in fast motion) despite seeing the distance is very close. When floating in between portals the camera will dizzy the hell out of you due to slow view reset, plus your mouse is interfered regularly. Then comes the ridiculous steps calculation, it counts although you didn't move (thanks, Source physics). To sum up, the Challenges mode is a dick move to block 100% achievement away from you.  
.
I gave Portal an 8 out 10

este es un gran juego para entretenerse y frustrarse al mismo tiempo con sus misiones

Picked this game up in the valve bundle sale, I must say it was a great decision. This is a fantastic game.
Now don't get me wrong, this game will piss you off at times because of the puzzles or misplacing the portal once or twice. 

But it will be worth it, for in the end it's not about beating the game, or even the cake. It's about experiencing the best credits one could make.

解密的欢乐。

[h1][b]Very Serious Review - Half Life but everything is robots[/b][/h1]

The only good science is the one that tries to kill you, in my humble opinion. 

[b][u]That one question[/u][/b]

[i]What's a "Portal"?[/i]

It's a thing that you shoot from a gun. You can have two of them at one time, you jump into one and come out from the other. You could use them to solve puzzles or you could infinitely fall until you get sick. I'm not judging. 

[b][u]The Good Guys[/u][/b]

[b]ALL PRAISE LORD GABEN![/b]

If you love Steam -which is the platform that you're on, by the way- you probably know [b]Valve[/b]. It's that company that sells all of their game for [i]50p[/i] each once a month. Also they own this site and part of your monthly income. They're known for developing incredible games, innovating the market and not knowing how to count to three.
Valve is one of the most beloved and lovable developers/publishers around and I'm currently looking for a job. I'm not saying hire me but please at least notice me, Lord Gaben. 

[b][u]The Bad Guys[/u][/b]

Portal is self published. No loot boxes or dlcs here. We leave that stuff to the [u]dark side[/u] of the company.

[b][h1]Script - A[/h1][/b]

I mean, take this score lightly. Portal is more of a tutorial for Portal 2. It doesn't really have a huge story. 

You're a test subject in an abandoned scientific facility. Cortana wants you dead but you don't like that so you try not to be dead. 
It's good, for what it is. It's a good starting point for the more complex plot of the second game but the narrative is just superb! like oh-oh, mon dieu! Baguette! [i]*finger kiss*[/i]Even if the story is extremely simple it is also really well written and the jokes are just so funny! If you've been on the internet long enough, you probably heard the expression "the cake is a lie". This is where it comes from. No spoilers. Pick up the game and shut up.

Chell, the main character, doesn't really talk and you don't really know much about her but GLaDOS, uh. She IS the game, no question asked. 
GLaDOS will be your guide AND you main antagonist. She is a big meanie bus she's also so charming!
[i]She attac, she protec but most importantly she cak(e)[/i].
Every line of dialogue from this character is a pearl and her design is, generally speaking, a work of art. 

[b][h1]Gameplay - S[/h1][/b]

It's not a case if Portal won dozens of awards, mainly for the innovative mechanics and clever game design. Fluid controls, satisfying puzzles and balanced progression: Portal constantly challenge you and you want to demonstrate yourself that no, you're not stupid and yes, you want that cake, and no, you're NOT STUCK IN CHAMBER 17, [b]IF YOU'RE SO GOOD WHY DON'T YOU TRY IT YOURSELF, SUZAN!?[/b]

...

So there are all these social experiments, right?
The game is full of them. It revolves around science and so they decided to make science with it. It's genuinely interesting to see a social experiment introduced as a game mechanic in a videogame and it just adds so much to the general theme and design of the game.

[b]Companion Cube (No clickbait, Gone sexual, must watch) [/b]
[u]Please, stop the meme.[/u]

It took me less than one hour to beat Portal, a bit less than a couple of hours to one-hundred-percent it.
This is not a long game but it's not necessarily a bad thing!

Back in the days I used to race with my friends -when I actually [b]HAD[/b] friends- to see who can beat the game faster. 35 minutes was our record, not the greatest speedrun ever but we had a lot of fun! I replayed the game a lot and I'm still not bored of it.
Also, once you're done with the campaign, you still have a couple of challenges ahead:

[i]Advanced chambers[/i] makes you play a harder version of six maps from the main campaign. If you are already familiar with the game's mechanics these are fairly easy. 

The real challenge comes in the form of trials. In this game mode you have to find alternative ways to beat the same 6 stages from the main campaign by using less portals, less steps or in just less time. 

No, Suzan. I am not stuck in [i]Chamber 17 again[/i]. [b]LEAVE ME ALONE![/b]

[b][h1]Presentation - A[/h1][/b]

Portal is clean, sterile, which again it's really fitting. It's basically a white painting with a grey, nice frame and an orange and blue trim. It's pleasant, tidy, futuristic and mechanic. It's not the best looking game of 2007 but, honestly, it's Source's fault. I don't like how Source Engine looks. I guess it's a matter of taste? 
Portal is not a bad looking game by any means, it's just not [i]astonishing[/i]. Apart from that: models are great, really well made, and the palette choice is sophisticated yet not too pretentious. The game wants you to feel lonely, alienated and lost in a cold and hostile maze and it manages quite well.  

[b][h1]Conclusion - A[/h1][/b]

[i]I lik gam. [/i]

Good stuff, much fun, very science, many thumbs ups. 
A must play. 

And that was a rhyme, just realized. You're welcome.
